name: Stellar Parallax
explanation: Parallax is apparent shift of nearby stars against distant background as Earth orbits Sun. Parallax angle (p) measured in arcseconds. Distance d = 1/p parsecs. This is fundamental method for measuring stellar distances. Works for stars within ~1000 parsecs. Used to calibrate other distance measurement techniques.

examples.problem: Star has parallax 0.1 arcseconds. What is distance?
Why is parallax limited to nearby stars?
examples.solution: Parallax angles become too small to measure accurately for distant stars
